title: How the hell is this even possible? Swain's q doesn't work with any spell items.
body:
Went through, using spellthief, thinking it was just a "This is op since q ticks alot." Ignoring Morg exists. Then I tried Liandry's torment. Nothing. I've done Rylais before, not expecting much, but they don't get the freeze effect either. 

Like, what the fuck riot. Testing, do some.

replies.body:
Just looked into this and its a good news/bad news situation. The bad news is yep, that's definitely happening, sorry about that. That probably is costing an already weak champion a noticeable amount of power. 

The good news is that someone fixed this last week just in time for the cutoff for submissions for patch 6.10. That fix should be going out early next week as a result (assuming no patch delays).
Riots on it, give em some credit.

Aren't we supposed to ignore all the good things they do so we can complain that they never care?

I'm getting mixed messages on these boards.
Do what you would do if your s,o is sending mixed signals

I can't exactly tickle the boards in certain places, do inappropriate things in certain areas, and make jokes about my mouth being an animal shelter.

Not without you guys buying me a drink first.
... I need an adult.
*I am an adult.*

> 
> The good news is that someone fixed this last week just in time for the cutoff for submissions for patch 6.10. That fix should be going out early next week as a result (assuming no patch delays).

I noticed that Swain's Q was applying the full strength, 4 second DoT from Deathfire Touch, is this intentional?

> [{quoted}](name=Quepha,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=p1vumYJs,comment-id=00050002,timestamp=2016-05-14T23:23:13.163+0000)
>
> I noticed that Swain's Q was applying the full strength, 4 second DoT from Deathfire Touch, is this intentional?

Well technically its single target, right?

Just because that single target can swap out over the 4 second duration of the spell.

Know how DF works with malz's E?

Similar situation, probably also 4 seconds

> [{quoted}](name=Fovere,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=p1vumYJs,comment-id=000500020000,timestamp=2016-05-15T15:29:18.406+0000)
>
> Well technically its single target, right?
> 
> Just because that single target can swap out over the 4 second duration of the spell.
> 
> Know how DF works with malz's E?
> 
> Similar situation, probably also 4 seconds

Malz's E is a DoT so it causes 1 second length DFT procs on every tick.

not only that, but swain's Q can switch targets meaning it is technically not a single target spell.

I imagine it's like how Morgana pool can insta-proc Thunderlord's while stuff like Malz E can't.

In that case, Morgana's pool deals damage over time, but isn't a "DoT" - a debuff that deals damage over its duration. Instead, it places down a thinker that deals damage in an AoE around it every x seconds. It's not really difficult at all the see how these are entirely different - Thunderlord's is programmed to only get one stack from DoTs through only getting a single stack from a DoT debuff, but since the pool doesn't function as a debuff it doesn't care and applies a stack with every tic.

This is actually a very similar situation. Swain Q places down a thinker the deals damage to a single target every x seconds - there's no debuff at all, and therefore it's not a DoT in-code. But it also only hits a single target, and while that target can be switched, a single Beatrice can still only laser a single enemy at a time.

When it comes to games, you need to actually break down what's happening in terms like this, as that's how they actually function given that they're all just instructions for a computer and a computer is a very literal thinker. A lot of weird "exceptions" come up due to this, but they aren't exceptions at all - the computer's just thinking about what's happening in a different way than you are.

That's not the only bug with Swains Q, I recently got an assist on my own death, using Swains Q :P
I might try to reproduce it and make a bug report, but letting you guys know is a step in the right direction I guess c:

I can confirm, had that happen to me the other day.

I assisted on my own death doing ~300 damage with Decrepify... as Kha'Zix.

great! lets upvote this.... naww 70s probably 1 too high ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

But seriously good news, i tried out swain support in ranked, figured since zonyas was cheaper and Q is a stronger support spell that it should be at the very least OK, then noticed i got no gold from Q and had to use my E for the rest of laning phase :/
meddler more like best riot employee

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=p1vumYJs,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-05-14T21:32:13.761+0000)

If he's weak, then why not revert his W nerf?
I just went into a custom to recheck things. Luden's also won't proc from it. Yay.

For rylais crystal scepter.
If I remember right this season slows do not stack anymore.
So if an ability cause more than 40% slow then it would take priority until the ability is over. Meaning rylais would not proc. Pretty sure but still not 100%...check me on that

it will still proc. it just doesn't stack. It "stacks" in that if the duration for one is longer than the other the longer duration gets used, but the actual slow amount doesn't stack - you can have multiple slow debuffs at once, but only the strongest one actually slows you.
Did old q proc spell effects?

Yes, even if it didn't, which I'd take to be in a buff itself, the game isn't procing effects of any kind it seems, despite the new q being a spell. Probably due to the stationary nature of the spell.
wth? this happens? No wonder his win rate is so low
The only item that really affects Swain out of this is Liandry's which is still a meh item.
Liandry's is actually great on Swain. AP, Magic pen, health, and a percent health DOT effect. On a champion that builds AP and health and is best in longer fights because of his DOT abilities.

Liandry's does meh %CURRENT health, relies on also buying Rylai's 9 times out of 10, and had an atrocious build path (Haunting Guise is one of the worst items in the game that BARELY has 100% cost effeciency but  a good chunk of it is on the health component which is not AP) with 2 combine costs of 700+ gold.
I hardly think the Liandry's shred is "meh". Swain can get away without Rylai's, though he still benefits from it for his ult/E, as his Q and W alone will proc the empowered shred.

Nice job being a reasonable person and not cursing for no reason. Furthermore I like appreciate how you make sure to take into account how much work Riot does everyday in order to make this great game which they allow us to play for free! 

Keep it up man! You are the reason I love this community!!!!

Though the Op said it in a douchey way.... he has a point, what is the PBE for? 

Thats right, its for showing new skins and getting promoted!!!

Wat?

How does this even happen? No wonder the champ is garbage.
Rito at it again. Can probably include PBE in there too.
bump, this is dumb
